[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: SerializationError] [Deserialization attack] Can a Byzantine validator send maliciously crafted serialized data that triggers SerializationError, causing denial of service or state corruption? (High)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: SerializationError] [JSON injection] Does the SerializationError conversion from serde_json::Error properly sanitize error messages, or can JSON parsing errors be exploited for log injection? (Low)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: SerializationError] [Memory exhaustion] Can attackers craft deeply nested or extremely large JSON payloads that trigger SerializationError after exhausting memory? (Medium)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: ValidatorKeyNotFound] [Key deletion attack] Can an attacker delete validator private keys from secure storage to trigger ValidatorKeyNotFound, preventing validators from participating in consensus? (High)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: ValidatorKeyNotFound] [Key rotation exploitation] During key rotation, can race conditions cause legitimate keys to trigger ValidatorKeyNotFound, causing consensus disruptions? (Medium)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: ValidatorKeyNotFound] [Initialization bypass] Can validators start without proper key initialization but bypass ValidatorKeyNotFound checks until critical operations fail? (High)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: ValidatorNotInSet] [Validator set manipulation] Can Byzantine actors inject themselves into proposals despite triggering ValidatorNotInSet, causing validator set confusion? (Critical)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: ValidatorNotInSet] [Epoch transition bypass] During epoch transitions, can removed validators continue participating briefly before ValidatorNotInSet checks take effect? (High)
[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: ValidatorNotInSet] [Address spoofing] Can attackers spoof validator addresses to bypass ValidatorNotInSet validation? (Critical)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: VoteProposalSignatureNotFound] [Unsigned proposal acceptance] Can proposals without signatures be partially processed before VoteProposalSignatureNotFound is checked, causing state inconsistencies? (Critical)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: VoteProposalSignatureNotFound] [Signature stripping attack] Can attackers strip signatures from valid proposals to trigger VoteProposalSignatureNotFound as a denial of service? (Medium)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: NotSafeToVote] [2-chain rule bypass] Can a Byzantine validator manipulate the round numbers in NotSafeToVote validation (round, quorum_round, tc_round, hqc_round_in_tc) to bypass the 2-chain voting safety rule? (Critical)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: NotSafeToVote] [Quorum certificate manipulation] Can forged quorum certificates with manipulated quorum_round values pass NotSafeToVote validation when they should fail? (Critical)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: NotSafeToVote] [Timeout certificate forgery] Can malicious timeout certificates with invalid tc_round or hqc_round_in_tc values bypass NotSafeToVote safety checks? (Critical)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: NotSafeToVote] [Integer overflow in round comparison] Do the four round number comparisons in NotSafeToVote handle integer overflow correctly, or can attackers exploit wraparound to bypass validation? (High)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: NotSafeToVote] [Race condition in round state] Can concurrent updates to round/quorum_round/tc_round create race conditions where NotSafeToVote checks against stale values? (High)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: NotSafeToVote] [Safety violation] If NotSafeToVote validation is bypassed through any means, can this lead to voting on conflicting blocks and breaking AptosBFT safety guarantees? (Critical)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: NotSafeToTimeout] [Timeout rule bypass] Can attackers manipulate the four round parameters (round, quorum_round, tc_round, one_chain_round) to bypass NotSafeToTimeout validation and force premature timeouts? (Critical)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: NotSafeToTimeout] [Liveness attack via timeouts] Can malicious timeout requests that fail NotSafeToTimeout validation be used to prevent legitimate timeouts, causing consensus to stall? (High)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: NotSafeToTimeout] [One-chain round manipulation] Can the one_chain_round parameter be manipulated to bypass NotSafeToTimeout and enable premature round progression? (Critical)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: NotSafeToTimeout] [Timeout certificate chaining] Can attackers chain multiple timeout certificates to manipulate tc_round values and bypass NotSafeToTimeout safety checks? (High)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: InvalidTimeoutCertificate] [Timeout certificate forgery] Can Byzantine validators forge timeout certificates with invalid signatures that pass initial checks but trigger InvalidTimeoutCertificate later? (Critical)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: InvalidTimeoutCertificate] [Voting power bypass] Can InvalidTimeoutCertificate validation be bypassed by manipulating validator voting power to make invalid TCs appear valid? (Critical)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: InvalidTimeoutCertificate] [TC threshold manipulation] Does InvalidTimeoutCertificate properly verify the 2f+1 signature threshold, or can attackers craft TCs with insufficient signatures? (Critical)

[File: consensus/safety-rules/src/error.rs] [Error Variant: InconsistentExecutionResult] [State divergence] Can attackers exploit InconsistentExecutionResult by crafting blocks where ordered BlockInfo differs from executed BlockInfo, causing validator state divergence? (Critical)
